alert.note: Alert for Allendale (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 9:56AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following areas, Coastal Bryan, Coastal Liberty, Coastal McIntosh, Jenkins and Screven. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following areas, Allendale, Dorchester, Hampton, Inland Berkeley, Inland Colleton and Tidal Berkeley. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical Cyclone Idalia is forecast to track along the southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina coastline after making landfall in the Big Bend region of Florida early Wednesday morning. Rainfall is forecast to begin over southeastern Georgia as early as Wednesday morning, overspreading the region through Wednesday afternoon and into Wednesday night, with rainfall totals of 4 to 8 inches forecast. The heaviest rainfall is expected to occur Wednesday evening, coinciding with the high tide, exacerbating the flash flooding threat. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
